newsitem.title: FRANCE: Cegetel shareholders pact definitively approved.
newsitem.headline: Cegetel shareholders pact definitively approved.

text.p: The founding shareholders of the Cegetel telecommunciations joint venture which aims to rival France Telecom have definitively approved the final deal to create the company, a Cegetel spokeswoman said.
She quoted Generale des Eaux chairman Jean-Marie Messier as saying the agreement would be signed "imminently".
He said that other telecoms operators, notably NTT of Japan "had shown a big interest" in joining Cegetel, but he said there was no room for other companies. "We only have 100 percent," he said.
The partners are British Telecom Plc, Mannesmann of Germany and SBC of the U.S.
Generale des Eaux will have some 50 percent of Cegetel, BT 25 percent, SBC 15 percent and Mannesmann 10 percent.
